meanings.definition: The quality or state of being material.
meanings.sent1: The materiality of the rock made it heavy to lift.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the materiality of different substances.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the materiality of objects disappearing.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the materiality of the landscape in their painting.
meanings.sent5: The materiality of the fabric was evident in its texture and weight.

meanings.definition: The importance or relevance of something, especially in relation to a legal or financial matter.
meanings.sent1: The materiality of the evidence was crucial in the court case.
meanings.sent2: The accountant assessed the financial statements for materiality.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the materiality of paying bills.
meanings.sent4: The materiality of the situation hit him when he saw the financial report.
meanings.sent5: The materiality of the decision weighed heavily on their minds.
